critique: This executive order establishes the President's Advisory Council on the Arts. It aims to survey and assess the needs of the arts, identify relevant federal legislation, submit reports and recommendations to the President, encourage effective use of resources, and promote public understanding of the arts. The council is composed of various government officials and members from private life. It doesn't directly address immigration, national security, or economic regulation. It could be seen as slightly liberal due to its support for the arts and cultural institutions, and it centralizes some authority at the federal level by creating a federal council. It also promotes social inclusion by supporting various art forms and cultural expressions.
